sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: An Indian railway minister has revealed an electric signal error appears to have caused the railway crash that claimed more than 300 victims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The signal fault meant one of the two high-speed passenger trains was travelling on the wrong track.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The news came as engineers worked to remove the mangled carriages from the line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The major part was the removal of capsized coaches and wagons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So last night all the capsized coaches and wagons have been removed from site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now the major part left is the restoration of track, which is the rail track, which has to be set aside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the overhead wire, which we call OHG wire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, visiting some of the 800 people being treated in hospital after the crash, vowed to punish those responsible. Narendra Modi, visiting some of the 800 people being treated in hospital after the crash, vowed to punish those responsible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's been revealed the two express trains were carrying 2,296 people when the crash happened on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Showing their rejection of violence and gun culture, tens of thousands of protesters took to the streets of Serbia's capital, Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They were calling for President Aleksandar Vucic to stand down, holding him responsible for promoting violence and hate speech that they say led to two mass shootings last month that left 18 people dead, including schoolchildren.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The populist president rejected their calls. Many people rallied in Serbia's capital for a fifth time in a month following two mass shootings that shook the country. The crowds chanting slogans against President Vucic marched through the city center and gathered in front of his downtown office. University students led the march holding a banner that read Serbia Against Violence, which is the main slogan of the protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Some media report that this was the biggest protest so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Stefan Goranovic, Euronews, Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Recep Tayyip Erdogan announced his new cabinet on the day of his swearing-in to his third

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: presidential term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a sign his new government might pursue more conventional economic policies, he put former banker Mehmet Simsek, a former finance minister and deputy prime minister, in charge of the economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The appointment comes as Turkey is grappling with inflation that peaked at 85 percent in October. NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg was there hoping to urge Turkey to approve Sweden's membership of the alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Deadly violence is rare between the countries who signed a peace treaty in 1979 and maintain close security ties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sealed with a tweet, President Joe Biden signed the law on Saturday that averts what could have been an unprecedented crisis in the U.S. government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Benzema's time at Real Madrid. The striker is leaving the club after 14 seasons and, according to Saudi state-run television station Al-Ijibariya, has signed a lucrative two-year deal with Al-Itihad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In an official statement, Real Madrid praised his performance over the years, adding both parties agreed to end his stint with the club.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The striker has helped the Spanish side to 25 titles, a record for any player in the team. Among the titles of the current holder of the Ballon d'Or are five Champions Leagues, five Club World Cups and four Spanish Leagues. It's the end of a bittersweet

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: journey. Football club Paris Saint-Germain has confirmed Lionel Messi's departure at the end of the season after a two-year stay. Messi, 35, played his last match for the PSG on Saturday evening against Clermont to the sounds of jeers and whistles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Argentinian scored 32 goals in 74 matches, but the club failed to perform well in the Champions League, and for many fans, he embodied the team's shortcomings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
